p: Regarding the content of condensed tannins from the OFIEOH, it corresponded to 1.20 mg of epicatechin equivalent/g of dry extract concentration. Of note, it is important to mention that despite the significant phenolic content, other components that were not tannins were predominantly present in OFIEOH. Other studies with O. ficus-indica extracts described variations of tannin contents from 1.2 to 3.2 mg of proanthocyanidins/g dry extract [ 23]. According to reference [ 14], using extracts from fruit skin and seeds of Opuntia spp., the authors found that tannins were the main phenolic compounds, representing almost 50% of the total contents. Similarly, according to reference [ 11], it was verified that large amounts of tannins, as well as alkaloids and flavonoids were present in extracts from crude cladodes and ethanolic extracts of fruits of O. ficus-indica. This variation demonstrated that different portions of the plant could also affect the phytochemical composition. As mentioned before, different cultivation and climatic conditions can influence the composition of plant constituents [ 23]. This information also underscores the importance of studies using different fractions of plants, with the objectives to improve their activity and to identify their major components.
